p: The DCA Vantage albumin:creatinine assay is a quantitative method measuring albumin, and creatinine and reports a albumin:creatinine ratio. Urine albumin is linear between 5 to 300 mg/l and for creatinine linearity is between 1.3 to 44.2 mmol/l. The albumin:creatinine measurement covers the following range: 0.11 to 226 mg/mmol. Evaluation of the performance of this POC device in terms of measurement of urine albumin, creatinine and albumin:creatinine ratio against a laboratory-based method demonstrated excellent correlations (R 2 = 0.989, 0.987 and 0.991, respectively) with total imprecision of < 8.7%, and an inter-and intra-day imprecision of < 2.9% [ 18]. Albuminuria was used as a surrogate marker for nephropathy, and was defined as a urine albumin:creatinine ratio of > 2.5 mg/mmol for men and >3.5 mg/mmol for women [ 19].
